info.title: BrowserAct API
info.description:
BrowserAct's API lets you run BrowserAct workflows programmatically and monitor their execution.

**Core concepts (same as the Dashboard):**
- **Workflow**: a reusable automation blueprint (the "design").
- **Task**: a single execution record of a workflow (the "run").

## Base URL
All requests use the following base URL:

```
https://api.browseract.com
```

## API versioning
The API is versioned in the URL path (for example, `/v2/...`).

## Authentication
Authenticate with a Bearer token in the `Authorization` header:

```
Authorization: Bearer <API_KEY>
```

## Requests
- Send request bodies as JSON.
- Set `Content-Type: application/json` for endpoints that accept a body.

## Response codes
We use standard HTTP status codes:
- `2xx` for successful requests
- `4xx` for client-side errors (invalid parameters, missing auth, etc.)
- `5xx` for server-side errors

## Errors
For most error responses, the API returns a standard JSON envelope:
- `code`: non-zero means an error
- `msg`: human-readable error message
- `traceId`: include this when contacting support

## Pagination
List endpoints use **page-based pagination** with these query parameters:
- `page` (starts at 1)
- `limit` (1-500)

Paginated responses include: `page`, `limit`, `items`, `total_pages`, `total_count`.

## Webhooks (optional)
When creating a task, you can provide:
- `callback_url`: called when a task **finishes**, **fails**, or is **canceled**.
- `status_change_callback_url`: called whenever the task status changes (e.g. running -> paused -> running).

## Task status values
`created`, `running`, `finished`, `canceled`, `pausing`, `paused`, `failed`, `unknown`.

## Rate limits
To protect platform stability, rate limits may apply. If you hit a limit, reduce request frequency and retry with backoff.

## Need help?
Join our Discord community: https://discord.com/invite/UpnCKd7GaU

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description:
Create and manage **tasks** (executions).

Typical flow:
1) Start a task (`run-task` or `run-task-by-template`)
2) Poll for status (`get-task-status`) or full details (`get-task`)
3) Retrieve outputs from the task response once finished

tags.name: Workflows
tags.description:
Workflows are reusable automation blueprints created in the BrowserAct Dashboard.
Use these endpoints to list workflows and fetch a workflow's expected input parameters.

tags.name: Workflow Templates
tags.description:
Official workflow templates curated by BrowserAct.
Templates are a fast way to start with common scraping/automation use cases.

tags.name: Regions
tags.description: Supported proxy regions that can be used when running template-based tasks.

post.description:
Starts a new task execution for a workflow and returns a `task_id`.

### How it works
1) Choose a workflow in the Dashboard and copy its `workflow_id`
2) Provide any `input_parameters` required by the workflow
3) Optionally enable `save_browser_data` to receive a `profile_id` that can be reused later

### Webhooks
You can provide `callback_url` and/or `status_change_callback_url` to receive POST notifications.

withProfileAndWebhooks.summary: Save browser data and receive webhook callbacks

post.summary: Run an official workflow template (create a task)
post.description:
Starts a new task execution from an **official workflow template** and returns a `task_id`.

Use `GET /v2/workflow/list-official-workflow-templates` to discover templates.

get.description:
Returns just the current status of a task.

This endpoint is more lightweight than `GET /v2/workflow/get-task`.

Returns comprehensive information about a task, including:
- current `status`
- step-level progress (`steps`)
- output (if finished)
- failure details (if failed)

If you only need the current status, use `GET /v2/workflow/get-task-status`.

Returns a paginated list of tasks (workflow executions).

### Filtering
- Use `status` to filter by task status.
- Use `workflow_id` to only list tasks created from a specific workflow.

### Pagination
Use `page` and `limit`. The response includes `total_pages` and `total_count`.

parameters.name: workflow_id
parameters.description: Only return tasks created from this workflow ID.

put.description:
Resumes execution of a previously paused task.

- The task will continue from where it was paused.
- You **can't** resume a task that is `finished`, `failed`, or `canceled`.

200.description: OK. The task was resumed (or was already running).

put.description:
Cancels a running task immediately.

- Use this when you no longer need the result.
- A canceled task **cannot** be resumed.

**Tip:** If you only need to check progress, prefer `GET /v2/workflow/get-task-status`.

parameters.name: biz_code
parameters.description: Optional business cancellation code (for your own tracking/analytics).

200.description: OK. The task was canceled (or was already in a terminal state).

get.description:
Returns a paginated list of workflows in your workspace.

### Pagination
This endpoint uses page-based pagination with `page` and `limit`.

Fetches a workflow's configuration, including the **input parameter definitions** needed to run it.

If you only need a list of workflows, use `GET /v2/workflow/list-workflows`.

Returns BrowserAct's official workflow templates.

Use `keyword` to search by name/description.
Fetches the configuration for an official workflow template, including input parameter definitions.

Returns regions supported by BrowserAct.

You can pass a region code from this list as `proxyRegion` when running a template task.

ResponseData.description:
Standard error response envelope.

Most successful responses return the resource directly (without this envelope).
When an error occurs, you can use `traceId` to help BrowserAct support locate the issue.

code.description: Response code. `0` means success; non-zero means failure.

msg.description: Human-readable error message (present when `code` is non-zero).

data.description: Error details (shape may vary by error).

traceId.description: Error ID for tracking in logs.

InputParamItemDto.description: A single workflow input parameter passed when starting a task.

name.description: Parameter name (must match the workflow's input parameter definition).

RunWorkflowTaskRequest.description: Request body used to start a new task from a workflow.

save_browser_data.description: If `true`, the response will include a `profile_id`. You can reuse that `profile_id` in later runs to reuse browser data (e.g., cookies).

profile_id.description: Reuse browser data from a previous run (e.g., cookies) by providing a `profile_id`.

callback_url.description: Optional. HTTP/HTTPS URL to receive a POST notification when the task **finishes**, **fails**, or is **canceled**. Maximum length: 2048 characters. Must be publicly reachable (no private/local addresses).

status_change_callback_url.description: Optional. HTTP/HTTPS URL to receive a POST notification whenever the task status changes (e.g., running, paused, finished, canceled, failed). Maximum length: 2048 characters. Must be publicly reachable (no private/local addresses).

TaskCreatedResponse.description: Response returned after successfully creating a task.

id.description: The unique `task_id`. Use it to poll status/results or to stop/resume the task.

profile_id.description: Returned only when `save_browser_data` is `true`. Use it to reuse browser data (e.g., cookies) in later runs.

RunWorkflowTemplateTaskRequest.description: Request body used to start a new task from an official workflow template.

proxyRegion.description: Optional. Proxy region code. Defaults to `US`.

workflow_template_id.description: The official workflow template ID to run.

description.example: Scrape product prices and export CSV.

PageRespApiWorkflowDto.description: Paginated response containing items and metadata.

LiveUrlInfo.description:
Information for viewing a live task execution.

Available only when the task status is `running`.

live_url.description: Live view URL. Can be embedded in an `<iframe>`.

TaskFailureInfo.description: Failure details. Present only when the task status is `failed`.

TaskOutputDto.description:
Task output produced by the workflow.

The exact output depends on the workflow. Common patterns:
- `string`: plain text or JSON string
- `files`: URLs for output files (if any)

string.description: Plain output string (format depends on the workflow).

WorkflowTaskSimpleResponse.description: A simplified task representation used in list responses.

output.description: Present only when the task has ended.

live_url_info.description: Present only when the task is `running`.

profile_id.description: Browser profile ID for reusing browser data.

input_parameters.description: Workflow input parameters in key=value form.

PageRespWorkflowTaskSimpleResponse.description: Paginated response containing tasks and metadata.

WorkflowTemplateDto.description: A lightweight representation of an official workflow template.

detailUrl.description: Public detail URL for the template

PageRespWorkflowTemplateDto.description: Paginated response containing workflow templates and metadata.

WorkflowInputParameterDto.description: Definition of an input parameter expected by a workflow or template.

default_enabled.description: Whether the parameter is enabled by default in the UI.

input_parameters.description: Input parameters required to run this workflow.

TaskDownloadFileView.description: A file generated and uploaded by a task, with a pre-signed download URL (when available).

errorMessage.description: Error message if the file generation/download failed

TaskStepDto.description: A single step within a task execution.

evaluation_previous_goal.description: Evaluation result of the previous step

screenshots_url.description: Screenshot URL captured during this step

WorkflowTaskResponse.description: Full task details, including step-level progress and outputs (when available).

output.description: Present only when the task has ended.

live_url_info.description: Present only when the task is `running`.

profile_id.description: Browser profile ID for reusing browser data.

download_files.description: Files generated by the task (if any).

input_parameters.description: Input parameters used for this run, as `key=value` pairs.

log_detail_url.description: URL to detailed execution logs for this task.

TaskStatusResponse.description: Lightweight response containing only the task status.

detailUrl.description: Public detail URL for the template

input_parameters.description: Input parameters required to run this template.

TaskStatus.description:
Current task status.

- `created`: Task is created but not yet running
- `running`: Task is currently executing
- `finished`: Task completed successfully
- `canceled`: Task was canceled (e.g., via Stop Task)
- `pausing`: Task is transitioning into paused state
- `paused`: Task is paused and can be resumed
- `failed`: Task ended with an error
- `unknown`: Unknown or unsupported status

StepStatus.description: Status of an individual step within a task.

HTTPBearer.description: Send your API key in the `Authorization` header as `Bearer <API_KEY>`.
